result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Montrice Dwayne Hood

records.addlTxt: Court re-instates justice point at previous level. Court orders previous conditions to remain in full force and effect.

Defendant Montrice Dwayne Hood in court, via zoom audio, with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Discussion with parties put forth on the record. Court addresses defense's motion filed and schedules the next court date for a Motion Hearing. Court further sets 11/18/2022 deadline for the State's response. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Justice Point Discharge Report, filed. Forwarded to Judge for review.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report - 8-04-2022

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant's appearance has been waived for the purpose of today's hearing. Court further requests defense file written documentation with the court to supplement the defendant's non-appearance. Case adjourned for an additional Status Conference date to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Defense Motion to Suppress Based on Unlawful Warrant
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 7-29-2022

OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Montrice Dwayne Hood in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Jon R Josephsen appeared on behalf of Patrick Franken for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Discussion with parties. Court schedules next court date for a Status Conference, and sets 07/28/2022 deadline for filing any motions. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 6-28-2022
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Status Report - 5-13-2022

OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Montrice Dwayne Hood in court, via zoom, with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion with parties regarding outstanding discovery issues. Case adjourned for a Status Conference to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 5-04-2022
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 4-4-2022
Email correspondence with parties. Case re-scheduled for Scheduling Conference on 05/05/2022, Br 16.
Received & Filed, PRELIMINARY HEARING of Original Transcript (19 pages) commencing 03-09-2022 by KAREN K. PALIS.

Defendant Montrice Dwayne Hood in court with Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg; both appear by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer N. Schlei.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 3-08-2022
received and filed.
22RM011689  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff 03/08/2022

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Montrice Dwayne Hood in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Montrice Dwayne Hood in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Montrice Dwayne Hood appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
